vectors.text: Quantum entanglement describes correlations between particles that persist regardless of distance
Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong nothing can escape
The Higgs boson gives particles their mass through the Higgs field interaction
Molecular orbitals form when atomic orbitals combine in chemical bonding
Catalysis accelerates chemical reactions without being consumed in the process
Electronegativity measures an atom's tendency to attract electrons in a bond
CRISPR-Cas9 enables precise genome editing by cutting DNA at specific locations
Mitochondria generate ATP through oxidative phosphorylation in the electron transport chain
Synaptic plasticity allows neural connections to strengthen or weaken over time
General relativity describes gravity as the curvature of spacetime caused by mass
Wave-particle duality shows that light behaves as both waves and particles
Polymers are macromolecules composed of repeating structural units called monomers
Thermodynamic entropy measures the disorder and randomness in a system
Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy in chloroplasts
DNA replication is semi-conservative with each strand serving as a template
Superconductivity allows current to flow without resistance below critical temperature
Chirality in molecules creates mirror-image isomers called enantiomers
Epigenetics studies heritable changes in gene expression without DNA sequence changes
Dark matter provides gravitational effects but does not interact with light
Apoptosis is programmed cell death essential for development and homeostasis
